Header.Description: Metadata attributes that characterize CMOR variables. Each variable is uniquely idenfied by a compound name comprised of a CMIP6-era table name and a short variable name.

aerosol.abs550aer.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Ambient Aerosol Absorption Optical Thickness at 550nm
aerosol.abs550aer.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Optical thickness of atmospheric aerosols at wavelength 550 nanometers.

aerosol.abs550bc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the black carbon aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

aerosol.abs550dust.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the dust aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

aerosol.abs550no3.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the nitrate aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

aerosol.abs550oa.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the particular organic matter aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

aerosol.abs550so4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the sulphate aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

aerosol.abs550ss.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the sea salt aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

aerosol.airmass.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Vertically Integrated Mass Content of Air in Layer
aerosol.airmass.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: The mass of air in an atmospheric layer.

aerosol.aoanh.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.NH.cell_methods: area: time: mean (weighted by tracer mass)
aerosol.aoanh.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.NH.comment: Fixed surface layer mixing ratio over 30o-50oN (0 ppbv), uniform fixed source (at all levels) everywhere else (source is unspecified but must be constant in space and time and documented). Note that the source could be 1yr/yr, so the tracer concentration provides mean age in years. For method using linearly increasing tracer include a method attribute: "linearly increasing tracer"For method using uniform source (1yr/yr) include a method attribute: "uniform source"
aerosol.aoanh.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.NH.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean (weighted by tracer mass),

aerosol.bry.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Inorganic Bromine Volume Mixing Ratio
aerosol.bry.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.comment: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Bry = Br + BrO + HOBr + HBr + BrONO2 + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic bromine (e.g., HBr and inorganic bromine oxides and radicals (e.g., BrO, atomic bromine (Br), bromine nitrate (BrONO2)) resulting from degradation of bromine-containing organicsource gases (halons, methyl bromide, VSLS), and natural inorganic bromine sources (e.g., volcanoes, sea salt, and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
aerosol.bry.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

aerosol.bs550aer.tpt-al-hxy-u.6hr.GLB.comment: Aerosol  Backscatter at wavelength 550nm and scattering angle 180 degrees, computed from extinction and lidar ratio

aerosol.c2h6.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

aerosol.c3h6.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

aerosol.c3h8.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

aerosol.ccldncl.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing liquid topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere)
aerosol.ccldncl.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops
aerosol.ccldncl.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
aerosol.ccldncl.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where convective_cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing liquid topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere),

aerosol.ccldncl.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing liquid topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere)
aerosol.ccldncl.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.mon.GLB.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops
aerosol.ccldncl.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.mon.GLB.comment: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops

aerosol.ccn.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.mon.30S-90S.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing liquid topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere)
aerosol.ccn.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.mon.30S-90S.long_name: Cloud Condensation Nuclei Concentration at Liquid Cloud Top
aerosol.ccn.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.mon.30S-90S.processing_note:
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where convective_cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing liquid topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere),
This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of AERmon.ccnSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

aerosol.ccn.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing liquid topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere)
aerosol.ccn.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.mon.GLB.long_name: Cloud Condensation Nuclei Concentration at Liquid Cloud Top
aerosol.ccn.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where convective_cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing liquid topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere),

aerosol.ccn1.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.comment: This is the concentration of cloud condensation nuclei (CCN) at 1.0 percent supersaturation, based on aerosol chemical composition and size
aerosol.ccn1.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.processing_note: This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of AERmon.ccn1South30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

aerosol.ccn1.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the concentration of cloud condensation nuclei (CCN) at 1.0 percent supersaturation, based on aerosol chemical composition and size

aerosol.ccnp02.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.comment: This is the concentration of cloud condensation nuclei (CCN) at 0.2% supersaturation, based on aerosol chemical composition and size
aerosol.ccnp02.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.processing_note: This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of AERmon.ccn02South30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

aerosol.ccnp02.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the concentration of cloud condensation nuclei (CCN) at 0.2% supersaturation, based on aerosol chemical composition and size

aerosol.cdnc.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.comment: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration in liquid water clouds.
aerosol.cdnc.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.processing_note: This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of AERmon.cdncSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

aerosol.cdnc.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration in liquid water clouds.

aerosol.cfc114.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction of cfc114 in air

aerosol.ch3coch3.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction "mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". Acetone is an organic molecule with the chemical formula CH3CH3CO. The IUPAC name for acetone is propan-2-one. Acetone is a member of the group of organic compounds known as ketones. There are standard names for the ketone group as well as for some of the individual species.

aerosol.chepasoa.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Net Production of Anthropogenic Secondary Organic Aerosol

aerosol.chepsoa.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Chemical Production of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
aerosol.chepsoa.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: If model lumps SOA emissions with POA, then the sum of POA and SOA emissions is reported as OA emissions. "mass" refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.

aerosol.cly.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Inorganic Chlorine Volume Mixing Ratio
aerosol.cly.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.comment: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Cly = HCl + ClONO2 + HOCl + ClO + Cl + 2\*Cl2O2 +2Cl2 + OClO + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic stratospheric chlorine (e.g., HCl, ClO) resulting from degradation of chlorine-containing source gases (CFCs, HCFCs, VSLS), and natural inorganic chlorine sources (e.g., sea salt and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
aerosol.cly.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

aerosol.co.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

aerosol.co.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: This is the daily mean for CO volume mixing ratio in lowest model layer

aerosol.cod.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation_wavelength or radiation_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. "Cloud" means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

aerosol.cod.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.comment: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation_wavelength or radiation_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. "Cloud" means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.
aerosol.cod.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.processing_note: This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of AERmon.codSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

aerosol.cod.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation_wavelength or radiation_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. "Cloud" means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

aerosol.conccn.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the number concentration of air particles in air

aerosol.conccn.tpt-u-hs-u.3hr.GLB.long_name: Sub-daily Aerosol Number Concentration at CF sites
aerosol.conccn.tpt-u-hs-u.3hr.GLB.comment: The variable represents the instantaneous Aerosol Number Concentration at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

aerosol.depdust.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Fdry mass deposition rate of dust

aerosol.drybc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Dry Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass
aerosol.drybc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Dry Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass

aerosol.dryno3.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Loss rate of nitrate (NO3) aerosol from the atmosphere due to dry deposition

aerosol.dryoa.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Dry Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter
aerosol.dryoa.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Dry Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter

aerosol.dryss.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Dry Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
aerosol.dryss.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Dry Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol

aerosol.ec550aer.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean (weighted by downwelling solar radiation)
aerosol.ec550aer.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean (weighted by downwelling solar radiation),

aerosol.ec550aer.tpt-u-hxy-u.6hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean (weighted by downwelling solar radiation) time: point
aerosol.ec550aer.tpt-u-hxy-u.6hr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude alevel time1 lambda550nm CMIP7:longitude latitude time1 lambda550nm, nCHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean time: point CMIP7:area: mean (weighted by downwelling solar radiation) time: point,

aerosol.emiaco.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic CO

aerosol.emianox.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic NOx
aerosol.emianox.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Store flux as Nitrogen. Anthropogenic fraction. NOx=NO+NO2, Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

aerosol.emiaoa.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic Organic Aerosol

aerosol.emibbbc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: total emission rate of black carbon aerosol mass from all biomass burning
aerosol.emibbbc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Total emission rate of black carbon aerosol into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

aerosol.emibbch4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: total emission of CH4 from all biomass burning
aerosol.emibbch4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Total emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

aerosol.emibbco.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: total emission rate of CO from all biomass burning
aerosol.emibbco.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Total emission rate of carbon monoxide (CO) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

aerosol.emibbdms.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: total emission of DMS from all biomass burning
aerosol.emibbdms.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Total emission rate of dimethyl sulfide (DMS) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

aerosol.emibbnh3.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: total emission rate of NH3 from all biomass burning
aerosol.emibbnh3.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Total emission rate of ammonia (NH3) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

aerosol.emibbnox.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: total emission rate of NOx from all biomass burning
aerosol.emibbnox.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Total emission rate of nitrogen oxides (NOx) from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

aerosol.emibboa.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: total emission of organic aerosol from all biomass burning
aerosol.emibboa.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Total emission rate of particulate organic matter (organic aerosol) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

aerosol.emibbso2.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: total emission rate of SO2 from all biomass burning
aerosol.emibbso2.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Total emission rate of SO2 into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic).

aerosol.emibbvoc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: total emission rate of NMVOC from all biomass burning
aerosol.emibbvoc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Total emission rate of non-methane volatile organic compounds (NMVOCs) from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

aerosol.emibc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass
aerosol.emibc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

aerosol.emibvoc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Biogenic NMVOC
aerosol.emibvoc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field._If_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.

aerosol.emico.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

aerosol.emidms.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.
aerosol.emidms.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.processing_note: This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of AERmon.emidmsSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

aerosol.emidms.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

aerosol.emidust.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

aerosol.emiisop.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field

aerosol.emilnox.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Integrate the NOx production for lightning over model layer.

aerosol.eminh3.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

aerosol.eminox.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Store flux as Nitrogen. NOx=NO+NO2. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

aerosol.emioa.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Primary Emission and Chemical Production of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
aerosol.emioa.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the sum of total emission of POA and total production of SOA (emipoa+chepsoa). "Mass" refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4\*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.  Integrate 3D chemical production and emission field vertically to 2d field.

aerosol.emiso2.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

aerosol.emiso4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Direct Emission Rate of SO4
aerosol.emiso4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Direct primary emission does not include secondary sulfate production. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

aerosol.emiss.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
aerosol.emiss.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.
aerosol.emiss.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.processing_note: This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of AERmon.emissSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

aerosol.emiss.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
aerosol.emiss.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

aerosol.emivoc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. _If_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.

aerosol.h2o.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

aerosol.hcfc22.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the mole fraction of HCFC22 in air

aerosol.hcho.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

aerosol.hcl.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydrogen chloride is HCl.

aerosol.hcl.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydrogen chloride is HCl.
aerosol.hcl.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

aerosol.hfc125.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the mole fraction of HFC125 in air

aerosol.hfc134a.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the mole fraction of HFC134a in air

aerosol.hno3.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

aerosol.hno3.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
aerosol.hno3.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

aerosol.ho2.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydroperoxyl radical is HO2.
aerosol.ho2.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

aerosol.isop.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction of isoprene in air.

aerosol.lossco.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Carbon Monoxide

aerosol.lossn2o.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Nitrous Oxide

aerosol.lwp.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: The total mass of liquid water in cloud per unit area.

aerosol.mmraerh2o.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). "Aerosol" means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. "Ambient_aerosol" means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. "Ambient aerosol particles" are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.

aerosol.mmraerh2o.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB.long_name: Daily mean surface Aerosol water mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer
aerosol.mmraerh2o.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: Daily mean Aerosol water mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

aerosol.mmraerh2o.tpt-h2m-hs-u.3hr.GLB.long_name: Instantaneous surface aerosol water mass mixing ratio at CF sites
aerosol.mmraerh2o.tpt-h2m-hs-u.3hr.GLB.comment: This variable represents the instantaneous surface aerosol water Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

aerosol.mmrbc.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.comment: Dry mass fraction of black carbon aerosol particles in air.
aerosol.mmrbc.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.processing_note: This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of AERmon.mmrbcSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

aerosol.noy.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.comment: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model); list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. NOy = N + NO + NO2 + NO3 + HNO3 + 2N2O5 + HNO4 + ClONO2 + BrONO2 Definition: Total reactive nitrogen; usually includes atomic nitrogen (N), nitric oxide (NO), NO2, nitrogen trioxide (NO3), dinitrogen radical (N2O5), nitric acid (HNO3), peroxynitric acid (HNO4), BrONO2, ClONO2 add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
aerosol.noy.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

aerosol.o3prod.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: ONLY provide the sum of all the HO2/RO2 + NO reactions (as k\*[HO2]\*[NO])

aerosol.od443aer.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the aerosol optical depth (AOD) from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 443 nm"
aerosol.od443aer.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time CMIP7:longitude latitude time  lambda443nm, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

aerosol.od550aer.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550 nm"

aerosol.od550aer.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.30S-90.comment: AOD from ambient aerosols (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550 nm"

aerosol.od550aer.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: AOD from ambient aerosols (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550 nm"

aerosol.pod0.tsum-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Accumulated stomatal ozone flux over the threshold of 0 mol m-2 s-1; Computation: Time Integral of (hourly above canopy ozone concentration \* stomatal conductance \* Rc/(Rb+Rc) )

aerosol.reffccwctop.tavg-u-hxy-cl.mon.GL.cell_methods: area: time: mean where cloud (weighted by area of upper-most cloud layer)

aerosol.reffccwctop.tavg-u-hxy-cl.mon.GL.comment: Cloud-Top Effective Radius of Liquid or Ice Cloud at Liquid or Ice Cloud Top

aerosol.reffclwtop.tavg-u-hxy-cl.mon.30S.cell_methods: area: time: mean where cloud (weighted by area of upper-most cloud liquid water layer)
aerosol.reffclwtop.tavg-u-hxy-cl.mon.30S.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere.TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
aerosol.reffclwtop.tavg-u-hxy-cl.mon.30S.processing_note: This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of AERmon.reffclwtopSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

aerosol.reffclwtop.tavg-u-hxy-cl.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where cloud (weighted by area of upper-most cloud liquid water layer)

Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
aerosol.reffclwtop.tavg-u-hxy-cl.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where cloud (weighted by area of upper-most cloud liquid water layer),

aerosol.wa.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). atmos.areacell.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for Atmospheric Grid Variables
atmos.areacell.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.comment: Cell areas for any grid used to report atmospheric variables and any other variable using that grid (e.g., soil moisture content). atmos.areacell.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.processing_note: For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.

atmos.ccb.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area)
atmos.ccb.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
atmos.ccb.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

atmos.cldnci.tavg-u-hxy-cl.day.GLB.long_name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
atmos.cldnci.tavg-u-hxy-cl.day.GLB.comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.

atmos.fco2nat.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
atmos.fco2nat.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)
atmos.fco2nat.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: Report from all simulations (both emission-driven and concentration-driven) performed by models with fully interactive and responsive carbon cycles.

atmos.hfls.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.ATA.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
atmos.hfls.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.ATA.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xant yant time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

atmos.hfls.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.GRL.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
atmos.hfls.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.GRL.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xgre ygre time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

atmos.lat.ti-u-hs-u.fx.GLB.comment: Latitude is positive northward; its units of degree_north (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid_latitude should be used instead of latitude. Grid latitude is positive in the grid-northward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

the fx.lon comment also applies to latitude.
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

atmos.lon.ti-u-hs-u.fx.GLB.comment: Longitude is positive eastward; its units of degree_east (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid_longitude should be used instead of longitude. Grid longitude is positive in the grid-eastward direction, but its units should be plain degree.
atmos.lon.ti-u-hs-u.fx.GLB.processing_note:
Note that the CF convention and CMOR2 require that this field will be included in each file that contains a variable that is a function of the "site" dimension, so there is no need to save this field by itself.  It is included here simply to indicate that longitudes should be stored for the site grid in each file written.
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

atmos.mc.tavg-alh-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).
atmos.mc.tavg-alh-hxy-u.day.GLB.processing_note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

atmos.mc.tavg-alh-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell.
atmos.mc.tavg-alh-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

atmos.mc.tpt-alh-hs-u.subhr.GLB.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the updrafts).
atmos.mc.tpt-alh-hs-u.subhr.GLB.processing_note: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

atmos.mcd.tavg-alh-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

atmos.noaahi2m.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment:
mean 2m daily NOAA heat index.
The perceived air temperature when relative humidity is taken into consideration (which makes it feel hotter than the actual air temperature).
The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.
NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523(T) + 10.14333127(R) - 0.22475541(T)(R) - 6.83783e-3 sqr(T) - 5.481717e-2 sqr(R) + 1.22874e-3 sqr(T) (R) + 8.5282e-4 (T) sqr(R) - 1.99e-6 sqr(T) sqr(R)
where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%)
atmos.noaahi2m.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB.processing_note:
NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523T + 10.14333127R - 0.22475541TR - 6.83783 x 10-3T2 - 5.481717 x 10-2R2 + 1.22874 x 10-3T2R + 8.5282 x 10-4TR2 - 1.99 x 10-6T2R2
where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%).
Heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.

atmos.noaahi2m.tmax-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment:
max 2m daily NOAA heat index 
The perceived air temperature when relative humidity is taken into consideration (which makes it feel hotter than the actual air temperature).
The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.
NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523(T) + 10.14333127(R) - 0.22475541(T)(R) - 6.83783e-3 sqr(T) - 5.481717e-2 sqr(R) + 1.22874e-3 sqr(T) (R) + 8.5282e-4 (T) sqr(R) - 1.99e-6 sqr(T) sqr(R)
where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%)
atmos.noaahi2m.tmax-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB.processing_note:
NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523T + 10.14333127R - 0.22475541TR - 6.83783 x 10-3T2 - 5.481717 x 10-2R2 + 1.22874 x 10-3T2R + 8.5282 x 10-4TR2 - 1.99 x 10-6T2R2
where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%).
The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.

atmos.reffcclwtop.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by area of upper-most convective liquid water cloud layer)
atmos.reffcclwtop.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB.long_name: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud
atmos.reffcclwtop.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.
atmos.reffcclwtop.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by area of upper-most convective liquid water cloud layer),

atmos.rlds.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.ATA.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
atmos.rlds.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.ATA.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xant yant time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

atmos.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.ATA.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
atmos.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.ATA.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xant yant time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

atmos.scldncl.tavg-u-hxy-scl.day.GLB.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration "as seen from space" over stratiform liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

atmos.tnhusc.tpt-al-hs-u.subhr.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Convection

atmos.tnhusd.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion
atmos.tnhusd.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.

atmos.tnhusd.tpt-al-hs-u.subhr.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion
atmos.tnhusd.tpt-al-hs-u.subhr.GLB.comment: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.

atmos.tnhusmp.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics
atmos.tnhusmp.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.

atmos.tnhusmp.tpt-al-hs-u.subhr.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics
atmos.tnhusmp.tpt-al-hs-u.subhr.GLB.comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.

atmos.tnhuspbl.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
atmos.tnhuspbl.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive terms.

atmos.tnhuspbl.tpt-al-hs-u.subhr.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing

atmos.tnhusscp.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
atmos.tnhusscp.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: The phrase "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. "Specific" means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency_of_specific_humidity_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).

atmos.tnhusscp.tpt-al-hs-u.subhr.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation

atmos.tnhusscpbl.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
atmos.tnhusscpbl.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: To be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all bounday layer terms including and diffusive terms.

atmos.tnhusscpbl.tpt-al-hs-u.subhr.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
atmos.tnhusscpbl.tpt-al-hs-u.subhr.GLB.comment: To be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all bounday layer terms including and diffusive terms.

atmos.tntd.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Numerical Diffusion
atmos.tntd.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical temperature diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the temperature budget.

atmos.tntmp.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
atmos.tntmp.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.

atmos.tntmp.tavg-p39-hy-air.day.GLB.processing_note: This is the total temperature tendency due to parameterized physics, which is the sum of contributes from all relevant parameterizations. We ask that in the Essential Model Documentation modelling centers specify the parameterized process contributing to this tendency, and (where applicable) specific values of their tunable parameters used for the simulation.

atmos.tntscp.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: The phrase "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency_of_air_temperature_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).

We ask that in the Essential Model Documentation modelling centers specify the parameterization scheme used and the specific values of its tunable parameters used for the simulation, and a specification of the part of the gravity wave spectrum that is targeted by the parameterization (e.g., minimally, the effective resolution of the model).

atmos.wbgt.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB.long_name: mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature
atmos.wbgt.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment:
mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature (WBGT). 
Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGT) is a particularly effective indicator of heat stress for active populations such as outdoor workers and athletes.
The calculation should be done with: 
WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air and "P = surface pressure in Pa"
atmos.wbgt.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB.processing_note:
The calculation should be done with: 
WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, 
where T_C is temperature in degrees C, 
and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, 
where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", 
M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, 
M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air,
and "P = surface pressure in Pa"

Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGT) is a particularly effective indicator of heat stress for active populations such as outdoor workers and athletes.
The calculation should be done with: 
WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air and "P = surface pressure in Pa"
atmos.wbgt.tmax-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB.processing_note:

atmosChem.emiavnox.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Emission rate of NOx from aircraft

atmosChem.emic2h4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Total emission rate of ethene (C2H4) into the atmosphere

atmosChem.emic2h5oh.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the total emission rate of ethanol (C2H5OH) into the atmosphere

atmosChem.emic2h6.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the total emission rate of ethane (C2H6) into the atmosphere

atmosChem.emic3h6.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the total emission rate of propene (C3H6) into the atmosphere

atmosChem.emic3h8.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the total emission rate of propane (C3H8) into the atmosphere

atmosChem.emic4h10.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the total emission rate of butane (C4H10) into the atmosphere

atmosChem.emich3oh.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the total emission rate of methanol (CH3OH) into the atmosphere

atmosChem.emich4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the total emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere

atmosChem.emih2.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Total emission rate of molecular hydrogen (H2)
atmosChem.emih2.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the total emission rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) into the atmosphere (i.e., integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field)

atmosChem.emilkch4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere from freshwater lakes

atmosChem.flashrate.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.processing_note: frequency of lightning flashes per unit area

atmosChem.h2.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the mole fraction of molecular hydrogen (H2) in air

atmosChem.h2loss.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere due to chemical destruction

atmosChem.h2prod.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the production of molecular hydrogen (H2) in the atmosphere due to chemical production

atmosChem.hcfc22.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.GLB.cell_methods: height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample)
atmosChem.hcfc22.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22
atmosChem.hcfc22.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.
atmosChem.hcfc22.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample),

atmosChem.meanage.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

atmosChem.meanage.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GL.comment: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.
atmosChem.meanage.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GL.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

atmosChem.n2o.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

atmosChem.n2o.tavg-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
atmosChem.n2o.tavg-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry after the next one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)? CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where air,

atmosChem.n2o.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
atmosChem.n2o.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

atmosChem.n2o.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.GLB.cell_methods: height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample)
atmosChem.n2o.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
atmosChem.n2o.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry before the previous one).   Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)? CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample),

atmosChem.n2o.tclm-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
atmosChem.n2o.tclm-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
atmosChem.n2o.tclm-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the N2O does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as n2oglobal, not n2o.   If  N2O is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry after the next).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)? CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years CMIP7:area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years,

atmosChem.n2o.tclm-u-hm-u.mon.GLB.cell_methods: height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample)
atmosChem.n2o.tclm-u-hm-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
atmosChem.n2o.tclm-u-hm-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the N2O does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as ch4globalClim, not ch4global.  If N2O is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry before the previous one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)? CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:1.00E-09 CMIP7:mol mol-1, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years CMIP7:height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample),

atmosChem.o3.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

atmosChem.o3.tavg-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
atmosChem.o3.tavg-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: If this does not change over time (except possibly to vary identically over each annual cycle), report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)? CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where air,

atmosChem.o3.tclm-p19-hxy-air.mon.GLB.processing_note: If O3 does not vary from one year to the next, report 12 months, starting with January. atmosChem.o3.tpt-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the mole fraction of ozone in air, sampled on the first day of the month as an instantaneous field.
atmosChem.o3.tpt-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that this variable is an instantaneous field, sampled on the first day of each month, and not time-meaned over the month

atmosChem.o3ref.tclm-al-hxy-u.fx.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years
atmosChem.o3ref.tclm-al-hxy-u.fx.GLB.long_name: Fixed Reference Climatology of Mole Fraction of Ozone in Air
atmosChem.o3ref.tclm-al-hxy-u.fx.GLB.comment: This is the ozone mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when an ozone double call is active in the model.
atmosChem.o3ref.tclm-al-hxy-u.fx.GLB.processing_note: Use this when o3ref has a repeating climatological cycle.

atmosChem.o3ref.ti-al-hxy-u.fx.GLB.long_name: Fixed Reference Mole Fraction of Ozone in Air
atmosChem.o3ref.ti-al-hxy-u.fx.GLB.comment: This is the ozone mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when an ozone double call is active in the model.
atmosChem.o3ref.ti-al-hxy-u.fx.GLB.processing_note: Use this when o3ref has no annual cycle.

atmosChem.o3ste.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Stratospheric Ozone Tracer Volume Mixing Ratio
atmosChem.o3ste.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone.

atmosChem.rlutch4ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GL.long_name: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming reference methane field
atmosChem.rlutch4ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GL.comment: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference methane field

atmosChem.rlutcsch4ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon..long_name: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming clear sky and reference methane field
atmosChem.rlutcsch4ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon..comment: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field

atmosChem.rlutcso3ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.G.long_name: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming clear sky and reference ozone field
atmosChem.rlutcso3ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.G.comment: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field

atmosChem.rluto3ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field

atmosChem.rsutch4ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GL.long_name: TOA outgoing shortwave flux assuming reference methane
atmosChem.rsutch4ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GL.comment: This is the outgoing shortwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field

atmosChem.rsutcsch4ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon..long_name: TOA outgoing shortwave flux assuming clear-sky and reference methane field
atmosChem.rsutcsch4ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon..comment: This is the outgoing shortwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field

atmosChem.rsutcso3ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.G.long_name: TOA shortwave flux assuming clear sky and reference ozone
atmosChem.rsutcso3ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.G.comment: This represents the top-of-atmosphere outgoing shortwave radiative flux assuming clear-sky conditions when a reference ozone field is used in a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme

atmosChem.rsuto3ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: TOA shortwave flux assuming reference ozone field
atmosChem.rsuto3ref.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is top-of-atmosphere outgoing shortwave flux for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme, using a reference ozone field

atmosChem.stratch4loss.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.long_name: Loss of Stratospheric Methane by all chemical destruction
atmosChem.stratch4loss.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.comment: This is the loss rate of stratospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause as used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp). It should have zero values in the troposphere.

atmosChem.tropch4loss.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon..long_name: Loss of Tropospheric Methane by all chemical destruction
atmosChem.tropch4loss.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon..comment: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp).  It should have zero values in the stratosphere.

atmosChem.tropch4lossoh.tavg-al-hxy-u.mo.long_name: Tropospheric loss of methane by OH
atmosChem.tropch4lossoh.tavg-al-hxy-u.mo.comment: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane due to reaction with the hydroxy (OH) radical. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp).  It should have zero values in the stratosphere.

atmosChem.tropdo3chm.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.G.long_name: Net Chemistry Tendency of O3 in troposphere
atmosChem.tropdo3chm.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.G.comment: This is the net chemical tendency of ozone in the troposphere. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the definition of the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere.

atmosChem.tropo3ste.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GL.long_name: Tropospheric ozone volume mixing ratio due to stratosphere-troposphere exchange (STE)
atmosChem.tropo3ste.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GL.comment: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone in the troposphere. It represents the ozone volume mixing ratio in the troposphere that is considered to be stratospheric in origin. It should be consistent with the definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere and non-zero positive values in the troposphere.

atmosChem.wethno3.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the loss rate of nitric acid (HNO3) from the atmosphere due to wet deposition

atmosChem.wetnh3.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.long_name: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH3
atmosChem.wetnh3.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH3 at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.

atmosChem.wetnh3.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Surface deposition rate of ammonia (NH3) due to wet processes

atmosChem.wetnh4.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.long_name: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH4
atmosChem.wetnh4.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH4 at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.

atmosChem.wetnh4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Surface deposition rate of ammonium (NH4) due to wet processes

atmosChem.wetno3.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: This is the loss rate of nitrate aerosol from the atmosphere due to wet deposition

atmosChem.wetnoy.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.long_name: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NOy
atmosChem.wetnoy.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NOy at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.

atmosChem.wetnoy.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Wet Deposition Rate of NOy Including Aerosol Nitrate
atmosChem.wetnoy.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species, out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3aerosol, NO3(radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates.

land.albc.tavg-u-hxy-veg.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where vegetation (weighted by canopy area and by downwelling shortwave radiation at the surface)

land.areacell.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GRL.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for Ice Sheet Variables
land.areacell.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GRL.comment: Cell areas any grid used to report ice sheet variables. These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere)

land.c13Land.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.c13Land.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Mass of 13C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
land.c13Land.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).

land.c13Litter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

land.c13Soil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in soil.

land.c13Veg.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.c13Veg.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass).

land.c14Land.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).

land.c14Litter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.c14Litter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

land.c14Soil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.c14Soil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in soil.

land.c14Veg.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
