land.c4PftFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).
land.c4PftFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice). CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.cGeologicStorage.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.G.comment: Mass of carbon that has been intentionally sequestered in geologic storage. The definition of geologic storage here is that it be stored for periods of time that are long as compared to the simulation.
land.cGeologicStorage.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.G.processing_note: This variable should only contain carbon that is stored through processes that are represented by the Earth system model itself, not carbon that is stored solely on the basis of a forcing dataset. For example, if an ESM represents biomass energy with carbon capture and storage (BECCS) as a prognostic process, then the resulting carbon storage would be included here; whereas if a process like direct air capture (DAC) is represented solely as a negative carbon emissions flux in the scenario forcing dataset, then it would not be included here.

land.cLand.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cLand.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Carbon in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
land.cLand.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

land.cLeaf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cLeaf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.

land.cLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.

land.cLitterCwd.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cLitterCwd.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
land.cLitterCwd.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent.

land.cLitterLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
land.cLitterLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.long_name: Carbon  in Above and Below-Ground Litter Pools on Land-Use Tiles
land.cLitterLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.comment: end of year values (not annual mean)
land.cLitterLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time1 CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time1,

land.cLitterSubSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cLitterSubSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.comment: subsurface litter pool fed by root inputs.

land.cLitterSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cLitterSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Surface or near-surface litter pool fed by leaf and above-ground litterfall

land.cOther.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cOther.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stems and Roots

land.cProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
land.cProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.

land.cProductLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
land.cProductLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.long_name: Wood and Agricultural Product Pool Carbon Associated with Land-Use Tiles
land.cProductLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.comment: Anthropogenic pools associated with land use tiles into which harvests and cleared carbon are deposited before release into atmosphere PLUS any remaining anthropogenic pools that may be associated with lands which were converted into land use tiles during reported period. Examples of products include paper, cardboard, timber for construction, and crop harvest for food or fuel. Does NOT include residue which is deposited into soil or litter; end of year values (not annual mean).
land.cProductLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time1 CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time1,

land.cRoot.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.cropFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.
land.cropFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice). CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.cropFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.
land.cropFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.cropFracC3.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 crops
land.cropFracC3.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.cropFracC4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops
land.cropFracC4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.cSoil.tavg-d100cm-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cSoil.tavg-d100cm-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool Above 1m Depth
land.cSoil.tavg-d100cm-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
land.cSoil.tavg-d100cm-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time sdepth10 CMIP7:longitude latitude time sdepth100cm,

land.cSoil.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cSoil.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Level (Summed over All Soil Carbon Pools in That Level)
land.cSoil.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: for models with vertically discretised soil carbon, report total soil carbon for each level

land.cSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass in Model Soil Pool
land.cSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon mass in the full depth of the soil model.

land.cSoilLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
land.cSoilLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.long_name: Carbon in Soil Pool on Land-Use Tiles
land.cSoilLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.comment: end of year values (not annual mean)
land.cSoilLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time1 CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time1,

land.cSoilPools.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cSoilPools.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Pool (Summed over Vertical Levels)
land.cSoilPools.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: For models with multiple soil carbon pools, report each pool here. If models also have vertical discretisation these should be aggregated

land.cStem.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.cVeg.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.cVeg.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.

land.cVeg.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Grass Tiles
land.cVeg.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.
land.cVeg.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (mask=grassFrac),

land.cVeg.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Shrub Tiles
land.cVeg.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.
land.cVeg.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where shrubs (mask=shrubFrac),

land.cVeg.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Tree Tiles
land.cVeg.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.
land.cVeg.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where trees (mask=treeFrac),

land.cVegLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
land.cVegLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.long_name: Carbon in Vegetation on Land-Use Tiles
land.cVegLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.comment: end of year values (not annual mean)
land.cVegLut.tpt-u-hxy-multi.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time1 CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time1,

land.dcw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.depthl.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.long_name: Depth of Lake Below the Surface
land.depthl.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.comment: Depth of lakes, if this quantity is present in the model. If computed via volume and area, then this is lake volume divided by lake area.

land.depthsl.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.long_name: Total (Cumulative) Thickness of All Soil Layers
land.depthsl.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.comment: Total (cumulative) thickness of all soil layers. This is the sum of individual thicknesses of all soil layers.

land.dgw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.drivw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.dslw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.dsn.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.dsw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.esn.tavg-u-hxy-sn.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where snow (on land only) time: mean
land.esn.tavg-u-hxy-sn.day.GLB.comment: The flux due to conversion of liquid or solid water into vapor at the surface where there is snow on land
land.esn.tavg-u-hxy-sn.day.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land time: mean CMIP7:area: mean where snow (on land only) time: mean,

land.evspsblpot.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.evspsblpot.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.evspsblpot.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: at surface; potential flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

land.evspsblsoi.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.evspsblsoi.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.long_name: Daily water evaporation flux from soil
land.evspsblsoi.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: Water evaporation flux from soil but for daily averages i.e., the evspsblsoi variable, which is only currently defined for monthly averages

land.evspsblveg.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.evspsblveg.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: the canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

land.evspsblveg.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.long_name: Daily water evaporation flux from canopy
land.evspsblveg.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: The same as the current variable evspsblveg but defined on daily timescales.

land.fAnthDisturb.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fAnthDisturb.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation, Litter or Soil Pools into the Atmosphere Due to any Human Activity [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.fAnthDisturb.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Anthropogenic flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. That is, emissions influenced, caused, or created by human activity. Anthropogenic emission of carbon dioxide includes fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change, except forest regrowth.

land.fBNF.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fBNF.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.

land.fCLandToOcean.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GL.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fCLandToOcean.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GL.long_name: Lateral Transfer of Carbon out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
land.fCLandToOcean.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GL.comment: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

land.fDeforestToAtmos.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fDeforestToAtmos.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.long_name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.fDeforestToAtmos.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

land.fDeforestToProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.m.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fDeforestToProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.m.long_name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change
land.fDeforestToProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.m.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

land.fFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Excluding Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.fFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux) from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).

land.fFireAll.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fFireAll.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Including All Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.fFireAll.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: From all sources,  Including natural, anthropogenic and Land-use change. Only total fire emissions can be compared to observations.

land.fFireNat.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fFireNat.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Natural Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

land.fHarvestToAtmos.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon..cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fHarvestToAtmos.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon..long_name: Harvested Biomass That Goes Straight into Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.fHarvestToAtmos.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon..comment: any harvested carbon that is assumed to decompose immediately into the atmosphere is reported here

land.fHarvestToGeologicStorage.tavg-u-hx.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fHarvestToGeologicStorage.tavg-u-hx.long_name: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Geological Storage
land.fHarvestToGeologicStorage.tavg-u-hx.comment: Flux of carbon harvested from biomass that goes into geologic storage for the purposes of intentional carbon dioxide removal, via efforts such as bioenergy with carbon capture and storage (BECCS) or biomass removal and storage (BiCRS). The definition of geologic storage here is that the resulting carbon be  stored for a period of time that is long relative to that of the simulation.
land.fHarvestToGeologicStorage.tavg-u-hx.processing_note: Positive number represents a flux of carbon from biomass (down) to geologic storage.

land.fHarvestToProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mo.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fHarvestToProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mo.long_name: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool
land.fHarvestToProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mo.comment: be it food or wood harvest, any carbon that is subsequently stored is reported here

land.fLitterFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fLitterFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Litter, CWD or any non-Living Pool into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.fLitterFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources

land.fLitterSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fLitterSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
land.fLitterSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

land.fLuc.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fLuc.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.fLuc.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Land Use Change

land.fLulccAtmLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.G.long_name: Carbon Transferred Directly to Atmosphere Due to any Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Activities [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.fLulccAtmLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.G.comment: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon directly to the atmosphere due to any land-use or land-cover change activities.  Include carbon transferred due to deforestation or agricultural directly into atmosphere, and  emissions form anthropogenic pools into atmosphere
land.fLulccAtmLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.G.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

land.fN2O.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fN2O.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

land.fNAnthDisturb.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GL.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNAnthDisturb.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GL.long_name: Nitrogen Mass Flux out of Land Due to any Human Activity
land.fNAnthDisturb.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GL.comment: will require some careful definition to make sure we capture everything - any human activity that releases nitrogen from land  instead of into product pool goes here. E.g. Deforestation fire, harvest assumed to decompose straight away, grazing...

land.fNdep.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNdep.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land

land.fNfert.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNfert.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Nitrogen Added for Cropland Fertilisation (Artificial and Manure)
land.fNfert.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area

land.fNgas.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNgas.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)
land.fNgas.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.

land.fNgasFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNgasFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from Fire
land.fNgasFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire

land.fNgasNonFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNgasNonFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from All Processes Except Fire
land.fNgasNonFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to all processes other than fire

land.fNLandToOcean.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GL.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNLandToOcean.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GL.long_name: Lateral Transfer of Nitrogen out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
land.fNLandToOcean.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GL.comment: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

land.fNleach.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNleach.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Nitrogen Loss to Leaching or Runoff (Sum of Ammonium, Nitrite and Nitrate)
land.fNleach.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Leaching" means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, "runoff" refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.

land.fNLitterSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNLitterSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
land.fNLitterSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

land.fNloss.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNloss.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)
land.fNloss.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching

land.fNnetmin.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNnetmin.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Net Nitrogen Release from Soil and Litter as the Outcome of Nitrogen Immobilisation and Gross Mineralisation
land.fNnetmin.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.

land.fNOx.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNOx.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. "Nox" means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

land.fNProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Deforested or Harvested Biomass as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use or Change
land.fNProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

land.fNup.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNup.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Plant Nitrogen Uptake (Sum of Ammonium and Nitrate) Irrespective of the Source of Nitrogen
land.fNup.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere.

land.fNVegLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNVegLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
land.fNVegLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass.

land.fNVegSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fNVegSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
land.fNVegSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

land.fProductDecomp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fProductDecomp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.long_name: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.fProductDecomp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.comment: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.

land.fracInLut.tsum-u-hxy-lnd.yr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: sum
land.fracInLut.tsum-u-hxy-lnd.yr.GLB.long_name: Annual Gross Percentage That Was Transferred into This Tile from Other Land-Use Tiles
land.fracInLut.tsum-u-hxy-lnd.yr.GLB.comment: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as a percentage of atmospheric grid cell
land.fracInLut.tsum-u-hxy-lnd.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

land.fracLut.tpt-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
land.fracLut.tpt-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: End of month values (not monthly mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac_lnd = 0.5, frac_ocn = 0.5, frac_crop_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)
land.fracLut.tpt-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: mean time: point, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time1,

land.fracLut.tpt-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
land.fracLut.tpt-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.comment: End of year values (not annual mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac_lnd = 0.5, frac_ocn = 0.5, frac_crop_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)
land.fracLut.tpt-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: point CMIP7:area: mean time: point, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time1 CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time1,

land.fracOutLut.tsum-u-hxy-lnd.yr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: sum
land.fracOutLut.tsum-u-hxy-lnd.yr.GLB.long_name: Annual Gross Percentage of Land-Use Tile That Was Transferred into Other Land-Use Tiles
land.fracOutLut.tsum-u-hxy-lnd.yr.GLB.comment: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as percentage of atmospheric grid cell
land.fracOutLut.tsum-u-hxy-lnd.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

land.fVegFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fVegFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.fVegFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources

land.fVegLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fVegLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
land.fVegLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_mortality and mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_senescence is mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation.

land.fVegLitterMortality.tavg-u-hxy-lnd..cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fVegLitterMortality.tavg-u-hxy-lnd..long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality
land.fVegLitterMortality.tavg-u-hxy-lnd..comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

land.fVegLitterSenescence.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fVegLitterSenescence.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence
land.fVegLitterSenescence.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

land.fVegSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fVegSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
land.fVegSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

land.fVegSoilMortality.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mo.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fVegSoilMortality.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mo.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Mortality
land.fVegSoilMortality.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mo.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

land.fVegSoilSenescence.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.m.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.fVegSoilSenescence.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.m.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence
land.fVegSoilSenescence.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.m.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.comment: Total GPP of grass in the grid cell
land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (mask=grassFrac),

land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.comment: Total GPP of shrubs in the grid cell
land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where shrubs (mask=shrubFrac),

land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.comment: Total GPP of trees in the grid cell
land.gpp.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where trees (mask=treeFrac),

land.gppc13.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.gppc13.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.gppc13.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: The rate of synthesis of carbon-13 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

land.gppc14.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.gppc14.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.gppc14.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: The rate of synthesis of carbon-14 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

land.gppLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.gppLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.
land.gppLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

land.gppVgt.tavg-u-hxy-multi.day.GLB.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.gppVgt.tavg-u-hxy-multi.day.GLB.comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.

land.grassFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.
land.grassFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: add scalar coordinate typegrass and add "natural_grass" to the CF area type table.  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice). land.grassFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.
land.grassFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.grassFracC3.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.grassFracC4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 natural grass.
land.grassFracC4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.hfdsl.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.hflsLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.long_name: Latent Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
land.hflsLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
land.hflsLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

land.hfssLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.long_name: Sensible Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
land.hfssLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.comment: Upward sensible heat flux on land use tiles. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.
land.hfssLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

land.irrGw.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: the amount of water withdrawal for irrigation from ground water, including deep soil water, confined and unconfined aquifer, etc

land.lai.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.lai.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

land.lai.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.lai.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
land.lai.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

land.laiLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.long_name: Leaf Area Index on Land-Use Tile
land.laiLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
land.laiLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

land.laiVgt.tavg-u-hxy-multi.day.GLB.long_name: Leaf Area Index on Vegetation type
land.laiVgt.tavg-u-hxy-multi.day.GLB.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

land.landCoverFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Percentage of Area by Vegetation or Land-Cover Category
land.landCoverFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their  PFT definitions.   This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.
land.landCoverFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: need to explain how to define vegtype.  To facilitate model comparison, it is also requested that the aggregated land cover types called for in lines 28 to 35 be archived (but not in this variable).  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).   Note that the "types" will be model dependent and for each type there should be a full description of the PFT (plant functional type). land.mrro.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.3hr.GLB.comment: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell, averaged over the 3-hour interval.

land.mrro.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.mrro.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.comment: computed as the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell.

land.mrro.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.mrro.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

land.mrrob.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.mrsfl.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.mrsfl.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.long_name: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer

land.mrsfl.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.mrsfl.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer
land.mrsfl.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in ice phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

land.mrsll.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.mrsll.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
land.mrsll.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

land.mrsll.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.mrsll.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
land.mrsll.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

land.mrso.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.mrso.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.comment: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

land.mrso.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.mrso.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

land.mrsofc.ti-u-hxy-lnd.fx.GLB.long_name: Capacity of Soil to Store Water (Field Capacity)
land.mrsofc.ti-u-hxy-lnd.fx.GLB.comment: reported "where land": divide the total water holding capacity of all the soil in the grid cell by the land area in the grid cell;  reported as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.
land.mrsofc.ti-u-hxy-lnd.fx.GLB.processing_note:
This variable should exclude lake water and must refer to soil water only.
CHANGE: processing clarified.

land.mrsol.tavg-d10cm-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.mrsol.tavg-d10cm-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column

land.mrsol.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

land.mrtws.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: requested for C4MIP, OCMIP/OMIP, LUMIP, ScenarioMIP, DECK, DAMIP, GeoMIP, LS3MIP, ??

land.nbp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nbp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Biospheric Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.nbp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes  from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux  is into the land.

land.nbpLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Land-Use Tile [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.nbpLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.comment: Computed as npp minus heterotrophic respiration minus fire minus C leaching minus harvesting/clearing. Positive rate is into the land, negative rate is from the land.  Do not include fluxes from anthropogenic product pools to atmosphere
land.nbpLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.processing_note:
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

land.nep.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nep.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

land.netAtmosLandC13Flux.tavg-u-hxy-lnd..cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.netAtmosLandC13Flux.tavg-u-hxy-lnd..long_name: Net Mass Flux of 13C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.netAtmosLandC13Flux.tavg-u-hxy-lnd..comment: Flux of carbon 31as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).-

land.netAtmosLandC14Flux.tavg-u-hxy-lnd..cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.netAtmosLandC14Flux.tavg-u-hxy-lnd..long_name: Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.netAtmosLandC14Flux.tavg-u-hxy-lnd..comment: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).

land.nLand.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nLand.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Nitrogen in All Terrestrial Nitrogen Pools
land.nLand.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

land.nLeaf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nLeaf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.

land.nLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

land.nLitterCwd.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nLitterCwd.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
land.nLitterCwd.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

land.nLitterSubSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nLitterSubSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Below-Ground Litter (non CWD)
land.nLitterSubSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Subsurface litter" means the part of the litter mixed within the soil below the surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

land.nLitterSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nLitterSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Above-Ground Litter (non CWD)
land.nLitterSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

land.nMineral.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nMineral.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: SUM of ammonium, nitrite, nitrate, etc over all soil layers

land.nMineralNH4.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nMineralNH4.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: SUM of ammonium over all soil layers

land.nMineralNO3.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nMineralNO3.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: SUM of nitrate over all soil layers

land.nOther.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.nOther.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stem and Root

land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Net Primary Production on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.processing_note: needed for any model that does not compute GPP

land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.long_name: Net Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.comment: Total NPP of grass in the grid cell
land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (mask=grassFrac),

land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.long_name: Net Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.comment: Total NPP of shrubs in the grid cell
land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where shrubs (mask=shrubFrac),

land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.long_name: Net Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.comment: Total NPP of trees in the grid cell
land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where trees (mask=treeFrac),

land.nppLeaf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

"Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. land.nppLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

land.nppOther.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

land.orog.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.ATA.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. Altitude is the (geometric) height above the geoid, which is the reference geopotential surface. The geoid is similar to mean sea level.
land.orog.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.ATA.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xant yant time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

land.orog.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.GRL.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. Altitude is the (geometric) height above the geoid, which is the reference geopotential surface. The geoid is similar to mean sea level.
land.orog.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.GRL.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xgre ygre time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

land.orog.tavg-u-hxy-is.yr.ATA.comment: This is needed in case the ice sheet elevation changes in time
land.orog.tavg-u-hxy-is.yr.ATA.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xant yant time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

land.orog.tavg-u-hxy-is.yr.GRL.comment: This is needed in case the ice sheet elevation changes in time
land.orog.tavg-u-hxy-is.yr.GRL.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xgre ygre time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

land.orog.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.30S-90S.comment: height above the geoid; as defined here, "the geoid" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).
land.orog.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.30S-90S.processing_note: This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of fx.orogSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

land.orog.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.comment: height above the geoid; as defined here, "the geoid" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).

land.pastureFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Percentage of Land Which Is Anthropogenic Pasture
land.pastureFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.
land.pastureFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: add scalar coordinate typepasture and add "pasture" to the CF area type table. Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice). CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.pastureFracC3.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 pasture
land.pastureFracC3.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.pastureFracC4.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.prveg.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: the precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.

land.ra.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.comment: Total RA of grass in the grid cell

land.ra.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where shrubs (mask=shrubFrac),

land.ra.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.ra.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.comment: Total RA of trees in the grid cell
land.ra.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where trees (mask=treeFrac),

land.rac13.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.rac13.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.rac13.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Flux of carbon-13 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

land.rac14.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.rac14.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.rac14.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Flux of carbon-14 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

land.raLeaf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.raLeaf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Respiration from Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

land.raLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.raLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on land-use tiles.
land.raLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

land.raOther.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.raOther.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Respiration from Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

land.raRoot.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.raRoot.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Respiration from Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.raRoot.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Total autotrophic respiration from all belowground plant parts.  This has benchmarking value because the sum of Rh and root respiration can be compared to observations of total soil respiration.

land.raStem.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.raStem.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Respiration from Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

land.raVgt.tavg-u-hxy-multi.day.GLB.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.raVgt.tavg-u-hxy-multi.day.GLB.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on vegetation type.

land.residualFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
land.residualFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by "non-vegetation" and "non-bare-soil" (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)
land.residualFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: add scalar coordinate type???and add "???" to the CF area type table. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.residualFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
land.residualFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by  neither vegetation nor bare-soil (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)
land.residualFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Heterotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)

land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.comment: Total RH of grass in the grid cell
land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (mask=grassFrac),

land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.comment: Total RH of shrubs in the grid cell
land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-shb.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where shrubs (mask=shrubFrac),

land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.comment: Total RH of trees in the grid cell
land.rh.tavg-u-hxy-tree.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where trees (mask=treeFrac),

land.rhc13.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.rhc13.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.rhc13.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

land.rhc14.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.rhc14.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.rhc14.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

land.rhLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.rhLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Litter on Land
land.rhLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Needed to calculate litter bulk turnover time. Includes respiration from CWD as well.

land.rhLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.rhLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers), calculated on land-use tiles.
land.rhLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

land.rhSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.rhSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Soil on Land
land.rhSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Needed to calculate soil bulk turnover time

land.rhVgt.tavg-u-hxy-multi.day.GLB.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
land.rhVgt.tavg-u-hxy-multi.day.GLB.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers), calculated on vegetation type.

land.rivi.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.rivo.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.rootd.ti-u-hxy-lnd.fx.GLB.comment: report the maximum soil depth reachable by plant roots (if defined in model), i.e., the maximum soil depth from which they can extract moisture; report as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.
land.rootd.ti-u-hxy-lnd.fx.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean CMIP7:area: mean where land,

land.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Land
land.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over land. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
land.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.processing_note: This quantity is necessary to derive fluxes and albedo over portions of land grid cells that are snow-free or ice-free (see https://github.com/CMIP-Data-Request/Harmonised-Public-Consultation/issues/90#issuecomment-3323267867)

land.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-sn.mon.GLB.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Snow
land.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-sn.mon.GLB.comment: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell covered by snow but not by ice. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
land.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-sn.mon.GLB.processing_note: other than the different rule for spatial averaging, the variable is equivalent to Amon.rsds

land.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Land
land.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over land. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
land.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.processing_note: This quantity is necessary to derive fluxes and albedo over portions of land grid cells that are snow-free or ice-free (see https://github.com/CMIP-Data-Request/Harmonised-Public-Consultation/issues/90#issuecomment-3323267867)

land.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-sn.mon.GLB.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Snow
land.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-sn.mon.GLB.comment: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell covered by snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
land.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-sn.mon.GLB.processing_note: other than the different rule for spatial averaging, the variable is equivalent to Amon.rsus

land.rzwc.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

land.sftgif.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by land ice (ice sheet, ice shelf, ice cap, glacier)

land.sftgif.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.ATA.comment: This is needed in case the ice sheet area changes in time
land.sftgif.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.ATA.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xant yant time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

land.sftgif.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GRL.comment: This is needed in case the ice sheet area changes in time
land.sftgif.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GRL.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xgre ygre time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

land.sftgif.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.comment: fraction of grid cell occupied by "permanent" ice (i.e., glaciers).
land.sftgif.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.processing_note: For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.

land.sftlaf.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.long_name: Fraction of the Grid Cell Occupied by Lake
land.sftlaf.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.comment: Fraction of horizontal land grid cell area occupied by lake.

land.shrubFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.
land.shrubFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: add scalar coordinate typeshrub and add "shrub" to the CF area type table.  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice). CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.shrubFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.
land.shrubFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.sw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.sw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.comment: Total liquid water storage, other than soil, snow or interception storage (i.e. lakes, river channel or depression storage).

land.sweLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.long_name: Snow Water Equivalent on Land-Use Tile
land.sweLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "lwe" means liquid water equivalent. "Amount" means mass per unit area. The construction lwe_thickness_of_X_amount or _content means the vertical extent of a layer of liquid water having the same mass per unit area. Surface amount refers to the amount on the ground, excluding that on the plant or vegetation canopy.
land.sweLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

land.tas.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.30S-90S.comment: Hourly Temperature at 2m above the surface
land.tas.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.30S-90S.processing_note: This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of E1hr.tasSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

land.tas.tavg-u-hxy-u.1hr.GLB.comment: Hourly Temperature at 2m above the surface

land.tran.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).

land.treeFrac.tavg-u-hxy-u.yr.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

land.tsl.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.comment: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".

land.tsl.tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.processing_note: If soil layer thicknesses vary from one location to another, interpolate to a standard set of depths.  Ideally, the interpolation should preserve the vertical integral.

land.wetlandCH4.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.wetlandCH4.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Emissions from Wetlands
land.wetlandCH4.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: Net upward flux of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

land.wetlandCH4cons.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.wetlandCH4cons.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Consumption (Methanotrophy) from Wetlands
land.wetlandCH4cons.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.comment: Biological consumption (methanotrophy) of methane (NH4) by wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

land.wetlandCH4prod.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
land.wetlandCH4prod.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Production (Methanogenesis) from Wetlands
land.wetlandCH4prod.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.G.comment: Biological emissions (methanogenesis) of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

land.wtd.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

landIce.agesno.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean (weighted by snow mass on land)
landIce.agesno.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as "missing in regions free of snow on land.

landIce.lithk.ti-u-hxy-is.fx.GRL.comment: The thickness of the ice sheet

landIce.lithk.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB.comment: This variable identifies the thickness of a prescribed ice sheet. This information is relevant to better understand how different models treat ice. For models where an ice sheet is just orography + an ice sheet mask, the value should be set to zero. For models that explicitly resolve an ice sheet thickness, the thickness of the ice sheet should be provided.

landIce.lwsnl.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
landIce.lwsnl.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer

landIce.lwsnl.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: where land over land: this is computed as the total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

landIce.mrfso.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
landIce.mrfso.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB.comment: the mass (summed over all all layers) of frozen water.

landIce.mrro.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.GLB.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

landIce.mrroLi.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.ATA.comment: Runoff flux over land ice is the difference between any available liquid water in the snowpack less any refreezing. Computed as the sum of rainfall and melt of snow or ice less any refreezing or water retained in the snowpack
landIce.mrroLi.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.ATA.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xant yant time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

landIce.mrroLi.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.GRL.comment: Runoff flux over land ice is the difference between any available liquid water in the snowpack less any refreezing. Computed as the sum of rainfall and melt of snow or ice less any refreezing or water retained in the snowpack
landIce.mrroLi.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.GRL.processing_note:
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xgre ygre time CMIP7:latitude time,
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:xgre ygre time CMIP7:latitude longitude time,

landIce.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-is.mon.GLB.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
