ocean.sw17O.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.sw17O.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Isotopic Ratio of Oxygen-17 in Sea Water
ocean.sw17O.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Ratio of abundance of oxygen-17 (17O) atoms to oxygen-16 (16O) atoms in sea water

ocean.sw18O.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.sw18O.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Isotopic Ratio of Oxygen-18 in Sea Water
ocean.sw18O.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Ratio of abundance of oxygen-18 (18O) atoms to oxygen-16 (16O) atoms in sea water
ocean.sw18O.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Measures - CMIP6:area: areacella CMIP7:area: areacello, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude alevel time CMIP7:longitude latitude olevel time, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: mean where sea time: mean,

ocean.sw2H.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.sw2H.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Isotopic Ratio of Deuterium in Sea Water
ocean.sw2H.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Ratio of abundance of hydrogen-2 (2H) atoms to hydrogen-1 (1H) atoms in sea water

ocean.swh.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.swh.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

ocean.swh.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.swh.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

ocean.swhmax.tmax-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: maximum
ocean.swhmax.tmax-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Highest value of the significant wave height simulated within a given time range (e.g., daily or monthly). The significant wave height (swh) is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, swh is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

ocean.swhmax.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.swhmax.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Highest value of the significant wave height simulated within a given time range (e.g., daily or monthly). The significant wave height (swh) is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, swh is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

ocean.swhswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.swhswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This parameter is derived from all swell partitions of the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the components of the two-dimensional wave spectrum that are not under the influence of local wind.

ocean.swhswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.swhswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This parameter is derived from all swell partitions of the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the components of the two-dimensional wave spectrum that are not under the influence of local wind.

ocean.swhwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.swhwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). It is derived from the wind-sea wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wind-sea wave spectrum.

ocean.swhwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.swhwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). It is derived from the wind-sea wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wind-sea wave spectrum.

ocean.t17d.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.t17d.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: This quantity, sometimes called the "isotherm depth", is the depth (if it exists) at which the sea water potential temperature equals some specified value. This value should be specified in a scalar coordinate variable. Depth is the vertical distance below the surface. Potential temperature is the temperature a parcel of air or sea water would have if moved adiabatically to sea level pressure.

ocean.tnpeo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.yr.GLB.comment: Rate that work is done against vertical stratification, as measured by the vertical heat and salt diffusivity. Report here as depth integrated two-dimensional field.

ocean.vo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. ocean.vos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.vos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.GLB.long_name: Daily Surface Sea Water Y Velocity
ocean.vos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.GLB.comment: Daily surface prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
ocean.vos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.GLB.processing_note: Report on native horizontal grid. Surface values only.

ocean.vsf.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.vsf.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water
ocean.vsf.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
ocean.vsf.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year.  Positive flux implies correction increases salinity of water.  This includes all virtual salt flux, including that due to a salt flux correction.  Report on native horizontal grid.

ocean.vsfcorr.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.vsfcorr.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

ocean.vsfevap.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.vsfevap.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Evaporation
ocean.vsfevap.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.

ocean.vsfpr.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.vsfpr.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Rainfall
ocean.vsfpr.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.

ocean.vsfriver.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.vsfriver.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
ocean.vsfriver.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.

ocean.vsfsit.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.vsfsit.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
ocean.vsfsit.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
ocean.vsfsit.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: The priority set by the WGOMD was 2 for this field.  The sea-ice folks requested that the priority be raised to 1. Report on native horizontal grid.

ocean.wdir.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wdir.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wdir.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.wdir.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wdirswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wdirswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wdirswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.wdirswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wdirwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wdirwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wdirwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.wdirwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wfcorr.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wfcorr.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to flux correction divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
ocean.wfcorr.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year.  Most models now have zero water flux adjustment, in which case ignore or report zero. Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

ocean.wfo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wfo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.
ocean.wfo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.processing_note: Net flux of water into sea water, including any flux correction. Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

ocean.wfo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wfo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.
ocean.wfo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: net flux of water into sea water, including any flux correction. Report on native horizontal grid as well as mapped onto sphere.

ocean.wmo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.30S-90S.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
ocean.wmo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.30S-90S.comment: Upward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.
ocean.wmo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.30S-90S.processing_note:
Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.
This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of Omon.wmoSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

ocean.wmo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
ocean.wmo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Upward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.
ocean.wmo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

ocean.wo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.day.GLB.comment: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
ocean.wo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.day.GLB.processing_note: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

ocean.wo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.30S-90S.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.30S-90S.comment: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
ocean.wo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.30S-90S.processing_note:
Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native. Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit. ocean.wo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

ocean.wpdir.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wpdir.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wpdir.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.wpdir.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wpdirswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wpdirswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wpdirswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.wpdirswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wpdirwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GL.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wpdirwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GL.comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wpdirwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.wpdirwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

ocean.wpp.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wpp.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

ocean.wpp.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.wpp.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

ocean.wppswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wppswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just swell waves.

ocean.wppswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.wppswell.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just swell waves.

ocean.wppwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.wppwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just wind-sea waves.

ocean.wppwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
ocean.wppwindsea.tpt-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB.comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just wind-sea waves.

ocean.zfullo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.zfullo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB.long_name: Depth Below Geoid of Ocean Layer

ocean.zos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.zos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.GLB.comment: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. zos is the effective sea level as if sea ice (and snow) at a grid cell were converted to liquid seawater (Campin et al., 2008). For OMIP, do _not _record inverse barometer responses from sea-ice (and snow) loading in zos. See (Griffies et al, 2016, https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-3231-2016).

ocean.zos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.30S-90S.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.zos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.30S-90S.comment: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.
ocean.zos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.30S-90S.processing_note:
See OMDP document for details. Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.
This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of Omon.zosSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

ocean.zos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.zos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.
ocean.zos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: See OMDP document for details. Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.

ocean.zossq.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.zossq.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Square of Sea Surface Height Above Geoid
ocean.zossq.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.

ocean.zostoga.tavg-u-hm-sea.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.zostoga.tavg-u-hm-sea.day.GLB.comment: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change

ocean.zostoga.tavg-u-hm-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocean.zostoga.tavg-u-hm-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
ocean.zostoga.tavg-u-hm-sea.mon.GLB.comment: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.

ocnBgchem.arag.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.arag.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
ocnBgchem.arag.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time CMIP7:longitude latitude time depth0m,

ocnBgchem.arag.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.arag.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
ocnBgchem.arag.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

ocnBgchem.bacc.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.30S-.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.bacc.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.30S-.comment: sum of bacterial carbon component concentrations
ocnBgchem.bacc.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.30S-.processing_note:

ocnBgchem.calc.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.30S-.comment: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
ocnBgchem.calc.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.30S-.processing_note: This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of Omon.calcosSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

ocnBgchem.calc.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.calc.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
ocnBgchem.calc.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time CMIP7:longitude latitude time depth0m,

ocnBgchem.calc.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.calc.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)
ocnBgchem.calc.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.

ocnBgchem.chl.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.chl.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.day.GLB.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
ocnBgchem.chl.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.day.GLB.comment: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations at the sea surface.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of "Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration" plus "Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration"
ocnBgchem.chl.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.day.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time CMIP7:longitude latitude time depth0m,

ocnBgchem.chl.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.30S-9.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.chl.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.30S-9.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
ocnBgchem.chl.tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.mon.30S-9.comment: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of "Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration" plus "Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration"

ocnBgchem.dpco2.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.dpco2.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Difference in partial pressure of carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.
ocnBgchem.dpco2.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note:
Difference between atmospheric and oceanic partial pressure of CO2 (positive meaning ocean > atmosphere)
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time depth0m CMIP7:longitude latitude time,

ocnBgchem.dpo2.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.dpo2.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume.  The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.
ocnBgchem.dpo2.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: Difference between atmospheric and oceanic partial pressure of O2 (positive meaning ocean > atmosphere)

ocnBgchem.epn.tavg-d100m-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.epn.tavg-d100m-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

ocnBgchem.expc.tavg-d1000m-hxy-sea.mon.G.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

ocnBgchem.expc.tavg-d1000m-hxy-sea.mon.G.comment: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. ocnBgchem.frfe.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.frfe.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

ocnBgchem.fric.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.fric.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Downward Inorganic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom
ocnBgchem.fric.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: Variable value should be reported as the flux exiting the bottom of the deepest ocean layer.

ocnBgchem.frn.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.frn.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Nitrogen Loss to Sediments and Through Denitrification
ocnBgchem.frn.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase. 'Denitrification' is the conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen which are then emitted to the atmosphere.  'Sedimentation' is the sinking of particulate matter to the floor of a body of water. "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

ocnBgchem.fsfe.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Iron supply through deposition flux onto sea surface, runoff, coasts, sediments, etc
ocnBgchem.fsfe.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time depth0m CMIP7:longitude latitude time,

ocnBgchem.fsn.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.fsn.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Surface Downward Net Flux of Nitrogen
ocnBgchem.fsn.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Flux of nitrogen into the ocean due to deposition (sum of dry and wet deposition), fixation (the production of ammonia from nitrogen gas by diazotrophs) and runoff (liquid water which drains from land).
ocnBgchem.fsn.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time depth0m CMIP7:longitude latitude time,

ocnBgchem.limfecalc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.G.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.limfecalc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.G.comment: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

ocnBgchem.limfediat.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.G.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.limfediat.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.G.comment: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

ocnBgchem.limfediaz.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.G.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.limfediaz.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.G.comment: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

ocnBgchem.limfemisc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.G.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.limfemisc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.G.comment: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

ocnBgchem.limfepico.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.G.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.limfepico.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.G.comment: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

ocnBgchem.limirrcalc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon..cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.limirrcalc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon..comment: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

ocnBgchem.limirrdiat.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon..cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.limirrdiat.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon..comment: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. ocnBgchem.limirrdiaz.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon..cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.limirrdiaz.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon..comment: Growth limitation of diazotrophs due to solar irradiance. ocnBgchem.limirrmisc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon..cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocnBgchem.limirrmisc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon..comment: Growth limitation of miscellaneous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. ocnBgchem.sialgc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) depth: sum where sea_ice time: mean
ocnBgchem.sialgc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.long_name: Total Ice Algal Carbon Amount in Sea Ice
ocnBgchem.sialgc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Vertically-integrated content of carbon in ice algae, expressed as moles of carbon per square meter of sea ice.
ocnBgchem.sialgc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

ocnBgchem.spco2.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.30S-9.long_name: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
ocnBgchem.spco2.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.30S-9.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.

seaIce.evspsbl.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Evaporation and Sublimation
seaIce.evspsbl.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area. If a model does not differentiate between the sublimation of snow and sea ice, we recommend to report sidmassevapsubl as zero as long as the ice is snow covered, and to report any sublimation within the variable sisndmasssubl.

(2016) for more detail.

seaIce.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
seaIce.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Downwelling shortwave flux from the atmosphere to the sea-ice surface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
seaIce.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc)

seaIce.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.long_name: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
seaIce.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.comment: Upward shortwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
seaIce.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

seaIce.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.long_name: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
seaIce.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Upward shortwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
seaIce.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc)

seaIce.sbl.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Evaporation or Sublimation
seaIce.sbl.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Rate of change of snow mass through sublimation divided by grid-cell area. If a model does not differentiate between the sublimation of snow and sea ice, we recommend to report all sublimation within sisndmasssubl as long as the ice is snow covered.

seaIce.sfdsi.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Total flux of salt from water into sea ice. This flux is upward (negative) during ice growth when salt is embedded into the ice and downward (positive) during melt when salt from sea ice is again released to the ocean.
seaIce.sfdsi.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note:
Identical to the now-deprecated CMIP6 variable SImon.sfdsi
Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

seaIce.siage.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.comment: Age of sea ice since its formation in open water.
seaIce.siage.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

seaIce.siage.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.30S-90S.comment: Age of sea ice since its formation in open water.
seaIce.siage.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.30S-90S.processing_note:
Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. 
This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of SImon.siageSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

seaIce.siage.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Age of sea ice since its formation in open water.
seaIce.siage.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

seaIce.siarea.tavg-u-hm-u.day.NH.comment: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

seaIce.siarea.tavg-u-hm-u.day.SH.comment: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

seaIce.siarea.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.NH.comment: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.
seaIce.siarea.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.NH.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: sum time: mean,

seaIce.siarea.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.SH.comment: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.
seaIce.siarea.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.SH.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: sum time: mean,

seaIce.siareaacrossline.tavg-u-ht-u.mon..comment: Net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W, 81.3N) to (10.5E, 79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W, 70.6N) to (59.3W, 82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E, 76.5N) to (19.2E, 70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W, 66.2N) to (166W, 65N).

seaIce.sicompstren.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P = P\* h exp(-C(1-A)) where P\* is compressive strength, h is ice thickness, A is compactness and C is strength reduction constant.
seaIce.sicompstren.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

seaIce.siconc.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: Percentage of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the ocean grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.
seaIce.siconc.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time typesi CMIP7:longitude latitude time,

seaIce.siconc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.comment: Percentage of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the ocean grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.
seaIce.siconc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.30S-90S.processing_note:
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:% CMIP7:1, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time typesi CMIP7:longitude latitude time,
This is a regional subset of the variable. If you are producing the global equivalent of SImon.siconcSouth30, you should omit this regional South30 version.

seaIce.siconc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Percentage of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the ocean grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.
seaIce.siconc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time typesi CMIP7:longitude latitude time,

seaIce.siconca.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.comment: Percentage of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the atmosphere grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.
seaIce.siconca.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time typesi CMIP7:longitude latitude time,

seaIce.siconca.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Percentage of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the atmosphere grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.
seaIce.siconca.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time typesi CMIP7:longitude latitude time,

seaIce.sidconcdyn.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
seaIce.sidconcdyn.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Fraction Tendency Due to Dynamics
seaIce.sidconcdyn.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Total rate of change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence, etc.).

seaIce.sidconcth.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
seaIce.sidconcth.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Fraction Tendency Due to Thermodynamics
seaIce.sidconcth.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Total rate of change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes.

seaIce.sidivvel.tpt-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
seaIce.sidivvel.tpt-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.long_name: Divergence of the Sea-Ice Velocity Field
seaIce.sidivvel.tpt-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).
seaIce.sidivvel.tpt-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point CMIP7:area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point,

seaIce.sidmassdyn.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types
seaIce.sidmassdyn.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Total rate of change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence, etc.) divided by grid-cell area.
seaIce.sidmassdyn.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: mean where sea_ice over all___area_types time: mean	,

seaIce.sidmassgrowthbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mo.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types
seaIce.sidmassgrowthbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mo.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Basal Growth
seaIce.sidmassgrowthbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mo.comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area. Note that this number is always positive or zero since sea-ice melt is collected in sidmassmeltbot. This is to account for differential growth and melt in models with a sub-grid scale ice thickness distribution.
seaIce.sidmassgrowthbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mo.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: mean where sea_ice over all___area_types time: mean	,

seaIce.sidmassgrowthsi.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types
seaIce.sidmassgrowthsi.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
seaIce.sidmassgrowthsi.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.

seaIce.sidmassgrowthwat.tavg-u-hxy-si.mo.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types
seaIce.sidmassgrowthwat.tavg-u-hxy-si.mo.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Growth in Supercooled Open Water (Frazil)
seaIce.sidmassgrowthwat.tavg-u-hxy-si.mo.comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.
seaIce.sidmassgrowthwat.tavg-u-hxy-si.mo.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: mean where sea_ice over all___area_types time: mean	,

seaIce.sidmassmeltbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types
seaIce.sidmassmeltbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Bottom Melting
seaIce.sidmassmeltbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through melting/dissolution at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area. Note that this number is always zero or negative since sea-ice growth is collected in sidmassgrowthbot. This is to account for differential growth and melt in models with a sub-grid scale ice thickness distribution.
seaIce.sidmassmeltbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: mean where sea_ice over all___area_types time: mean	,

seaIce.sidmassmeltlat.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types
seaIce.sidmassmeltlat.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Lateral Melting
seaIce.sidmassmeltlat.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through lateral melting/dissolution divided by grid-cell area (report zero if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically). Always negative or zero.
seaIce.sidmassmeltlat.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..processing_note:
CHANGE: name, renamed from SImon.sidmasslat in CMIP6
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

seaIce.sidmassmelttop.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types
seaIce.sidmassmelttop.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Surface Melting
seaIce.sidmassmelttop.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area. This number is independent of the actual fate of the meltwater, and will hence include all sea-ice meltwater that drains into the ocean and all sea-ice meltwater that is collected by a melt-pond parameterisation. Always negative or zero.
seaIce.sidmassmelttop.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon..processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: mean where sea_ice over all___area_types time: mean	,

seaIce.sidmassth.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types
seaIce.sidmassth.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Total rate of change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area.
seaIce.sidmassth.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: mean where sea_ice over all___area_types time: mean	,

seaIce.sidmasstranx.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: X-component of the sea-ice drift-induced transport of snow and sea ice mass.
seaIce.sidmasstranx.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

seaIce.sidmasstrany.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.comment: Y-component of the sea-ice drift-induced transport of snow and sea ice mass.
seaIce.sidmasstrany.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:kg s-1 CMIP7:null,

seaIce.sidragbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. seaIce.sidragtop.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Atmospheric drag coefficient that is used to calculate the atmospheric momentum drag on sea ice.
seaIce.sidragtop.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note:
Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

seaIce.sieqthick.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types
seaIce.sieqthick.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area, also known as the equivalent thickness of sea ice.
seaIce.sieqthick.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types time: mean

seaIce.siextent.tavg-u-hm-u.day.NH.comment: Total integrated area of all Northern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

seaIce.siextent.tavg-u-hm-u.day.SH.comment: Total integrated area of all Southern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

seaIce.siextent.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.NH.comment: Total integrated area of all Northern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

seaIce.siextent.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.SH.comment: Total integrated area of all Southern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

seaIce.sifb.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.comment: Mean height of sea-ice surface (i.e. snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level. This follows the classical definition of freeboard for in situ observations. In the satellite community, sometimes the total height of sea ice and snow above sea level is referred to as freeboard. This can easily be calculated by adding sisnthick to sifb.
seaIce.sifb.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

seaIce.sifb.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Mean height of sea-ice surface (i.e. snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level. This follows the classical definition of freeboard for in situ observations. In the satellite community, sometimes the total height of sea ice and snow above sea level is referred to as freeboard. This can easily be calculated by adding sisnthick to sifb.
seaIce.sifb.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note:
Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

seaIce.siflcondbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Base
seaIce.siflcondbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.comment: Net heat conduction flux at the ice base, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the lowermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the base of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
seaIce.siflcondbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

seaIce.siflcondbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Base
seaIce.siflcondbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Net heat conduction flux at the ice base, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the lowermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the base of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
seaIce.siflcondbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

seaIce.siflcondtop.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Surface
seaIce.siflcondtop.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.comment: Net heat conduction flux at the ice surface, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the uppermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the surface of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
seaIce.siflcondtop.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

seaIce.siflcondtop.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Surface
seaIce.siflcondtop.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Net heat conduction flux at the ice surface, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the uppermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the surface of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
seaIce.siflcondtop.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

seaIce.siflfwbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice. This flux is positive when fresh water enters the ocean, and is therefore negative during ice growth and positive during ice melt.
seaIce.siflfwbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc)

seaIce.siflfwdrain.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean. This combines both surface meltwater that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt ponds. By definition, this flux is always positive.
seaIce.siflfwdrain.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. seaIce.sifllattop.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.comment: Net latent heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
seaIce.sifllattop.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). seaIce.sihc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
seaIce.sihc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.GLB.comment: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Water at 0C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. This variable does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine in the sea ice. Heat content is always negative since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water.

seaIce.sihc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
seaIce.sihc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB.comment: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Water at 0C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. This variable does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine in the sea ice. Heat content is always negative since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water.

seaIce.siitdsnthick.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GL.comment: Actual thickness of snow in each ice thickness category, NOT snow volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis). seaIce.simass.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: mean where sea_ice over all___area_types time: mean	,

seaIce.simassacrossline.tavg-u-ht-u.mon..comment: Net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W, 81.3N) to (10.5E, 79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W, 70.6N) to (59.3W, 82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E, 76.5N) to (19.2E, 70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W, 66.2N) to (166W, 65N).

seaIce.sirdgconc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is ridged sea ice.
seaIce.sirdgconc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc), CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:1 CMIP7:%,

seaIce.sisali.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.comment: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the mean salinity used in the calculation of the salt budget should be reported.
seaIce.sisali.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.processing_note: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

seaIce.sisali.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell. seaIce.sisaltmass.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.long_name: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice

Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the total mass of all salt in sea ice should be calculated from the salinity value used in the calculation of the salt budget.

seaIce.sishearvel.tpt-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.long_name: Maximum Shear of Sea-Ice Velocity Field
seaIce.sishearvel.tpt-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).

seaIce.sisndmassdyn.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GL.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Advection by Sea-Ice Dynamics
seaIce.sisndmassdyn.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GL.comment: Rate of change of snow mass due to sea ice dynamics (advection, divergence, etc.) divided by grid-cell area.

seaIce.sisndmasssi.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
seaIce.sisndmasssi.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always negative or zero.

seaIce.sisndmasswind.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.G.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Wind Drift of Snow
seaIce.sisndmasswind.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.G.comment: Rate of change of snow mass due to wind-driven transport into the ocean divided by grid-cell area.

seaIce.sisnhc.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.comment: Heat content of all snow in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Snow-water equivalent at 0 C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include the heat content of sea ice.

seaIce.sisnhc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Heat content of all snow in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Snow-water equivalent at 0 C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include the heat content of sea ice.
seaIce.sisnhc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

seaIce.sisnmass.tavg-u-hm-u.day.NH.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice North

seaIce.sisnmass.tavg-u-hm-u.day.SH.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice South
seaIce.sisnmass.tavg-u-hm-u.day.SH.comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.

seaIce.sisnmass.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.NH.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice North

seaIce.sisnmass.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.SH.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice South
seaIce.sisnmass.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.SH.comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.

seaIce.sisnmassacrossline.tavg-u-ht-u.mo.comment: Net (sum of transport in all directions) snow mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W, 81.3N) to (10.5E, 79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W, 70.6N) to (59.3W, 82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E, 76.5N) to (19.2E, 70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W, 66.2N) to (166W, 65N).

seaIce.sivol.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.SH.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: sum time: mean,

seaIce.snc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Percentage of the sea-ice surface that is covered by snow. In many models that do not explicitly resolve an areal fraction of snow, this variable will always be either 0 or 1.
seaIce.snc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

seaIce.snd.tavg-u-hxy-sn.day.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where snow (for snow on sea ice only)
seaIce.snd.tavg-u-hxy-sn.day.GLB.comment: Actual thickness of snow averaged over the snow-covered part of the sea ice. This thickness is usually directly available within the model formulation. It can also be derived by dividing the total volume of snow by the area of the snow.
seaIce.snd.tavg-u-hxy-sn.day.GLB.processing_note:
Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. 
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where snow over sea_ice area: time: mean where sea_ice CMIP7:area: time: mean where snow (for snow on sea ice only),

seaIce.snm.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Melt
seaIce.snm.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by grid-cell area. Always negative or zero.

seaIce.snw.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice over all_area_types
seaIce.snw.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.comment: Total mass of snow on sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This then allows one to analyse the storage of latent heat in the snow, and to calculate the snow-water equivalent.
seaIce.snw.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB.processing_note: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea___ice over all_area___types,

seaIce.ts.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.comment: Mean surface temperature of the sea-ice covered part of the grid cell. Wherever snow covers the ice, the surface temperature of the snow is used for the averaging, otherwise the surface temperature of the ice is used.
seaIce.ts.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB.processing_note:
Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.
